programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and returning Chef Chris McGowan is feeling confident but part of his dish involves making his own venison sausages to serve with a venison rack, and getting it all done in time is straining his emotions.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking their desserts and one chef is on course for an historic score, he could beat his boss a veteran of GBM and achieve more marks than anyone has done throughout the history of the competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the head to head. The two highest scoring chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort who are joined by guest judge, restaurant critic and Editor-at-Large of the Independent, Amol Rajan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the National Finals of Great British Menu. The chefs will mark each course of the fellow chefs dishes; the average of their scores will be added to the judges scores. There are some shocks and surprises as the chefs opinions differ from the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is day two of Great British Menus National Finals. Today the eight champions will cook their fish courses. Two chefs have reason to be confident after scoring tens from every judge in the heats. Can they deliver a perfect dish second time round?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the National Finals of Great British Menu and main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. It is a nerve wracking day for three of the eight regional champions.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the final day of the competition in this years Great British Menu, this is the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth lls Great Britons.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Great British Menus winning chefs arrive at the Palace of Westminster to cook for the Banquet of Great Britons. As the banquet is served the chefs show just why they are amongst the best in the country.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Todays challenge is to create outstanding dishes that capture a taste of summer and the prestige of Wimbledon

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more intense as all the chefs take risks with their fish courses

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its a smoke filled kitchen as the three chefs prepare their summer themed mains in the hope of impressing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are feeling the pressure as they attempt their technical summer desserts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Both chefs impress the judges with their inventive dishes; but only one can go through to the national final

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In the South West heats, this week, Tom Brown and Andy Clatworthy take on returning chef Dominic Chapman

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today it's the fish course and with a seafood specialist in the kitchen the competition steps up a gear.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today we have refined barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish dish and an historic tennis related recipe

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: chefs are honouring Wimbledon and the British summer with technically challenging strawberry desserts

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Guest judge Marion Regan joins, whose farm provides the famous Wimbledon strawberries to the Championships

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the North West regional heats, and three ambitious newcomers are competing for a place in the finals

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the fish course and the newcomer chefs begin to understand the perfection and skill that're demanded

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today is the main course, all three chefs have several elements to complete and are feeling the pressure

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure is intense.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Guest judge Greg Rusedski, former British number one, understands the high standards expected at Wimbledon.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: At the North East heats returning champion Tommy Banks takes on two newcomers Danny Parker and Josh Overington

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated; the three chefs are cooking their fish courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today the chefs are cooking their main courses and are all taking risks to try and win a place at the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All of the chefs are using unusual ingredients in their desserts and the pressure in the kitchen is intense

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs raise their game for this weeks guest judge, Judy Murray, mother of tennis champions Andy and Jamie

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This week chefs Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath return to the competition to battle newcomer Angela Malik

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets more heated as the veteran chef is expecting perfection from the fish course

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the first time in Great British Menu history, one of the chefs produces an entirely offal main course.

programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place in the final and the pressure in the kitchen rises

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Guest judge is Gary Parsons, Wimbledons Executive Chef, responsible for feeding everybody at the tournament

programme.desc: In the Wales regional heat newcomers, Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie, take on returning chef Phil Carmichael

programme.desc: Today the pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses.

programme.desc: Today its main courses and all 3 chefs are cooking Welsh lamb in the hope of impressing this weeks veteran
